-- | The <a>launchMissiles</a> action, as mentioned in:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>Beautiful concurrency</i>, by Simon Peyton Jones, to appear in
--   "Beautiful code", ed Greg Wilson, O'Reilly 2007.
--   <a>http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/simonpj/papers/stm/index.htm#beautiful</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Acme.Missiles

-- | Cause serious international side effects.
launchMissiles :: IO ()

module Acme.Missiles.STM

-- | Perform initialization needed to launch missiles in the <a>STM</a>
--   monad.
withMissilesDo :: IO a -> IO a

-- | Launch missiles within an <a>STM</a> computation. Even if the memory
--   transaction is retried, only one salvo of missiles will be launched.
--   
--   Example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   import Acme.Missiles
--   import Control.Concurrent
--   import Control.Concurrent.STM
--   
--   main :: IO ()
--   main = withMissilesDo $ do
--       xv &lt;- atomically $ newTVar (2 :: Int)
--       yv &lt;- atomically $ newTVar (1 :: Int)
--       atomically $ do
--           x &lt;- readTVar xv
--           y &lt;- readTVar yv
--           if x &gt; y
--               then launchMissilesSTM
--               else return ()
--       threadDelay 100000
--   </pre>
launchMissilesSTM :: STM ()
